claim: Schindler's List is the top film on AFI's list of 100 greatest American movies released after 1980.

supporting.text: Schindler's List is ranked as the 9th greatest American film of all time on AFI's 100 Years...100 Movies (10th Anniversary Edition) list, which includes films released before and after 1980.

attacks.text: Schindler's List is ranked as the 9th greatest American film of all time on AFI's 100 Years...100 Movies (10th Anniversary Edition) list, which includes films released before and after 1980.
The claim specifies films released after 1980, and AFI's ranking includes films from all time periods, making it unclear if Schindler's List is the top post-1980 film.
AFI's 10th Anniversary Edition list does not provide a separate ranking for post-1980 films, so Schindler's List's position relative to other post-1980 films is not directly confirmed.
Schindler's List is widely regarded as one of the greatest films of the late 20th century, and its high overall ranking suggests it likely performs well among post-1980 films.
Other post-1980 films like The Shawshank Redemption or Pulp Fiction may also rank highly, so Schindler's List is not definitively the top post-1980 film based on this list.

supporting.text: The AFI does not have a separate list ranking the top 100 American movies released exclusively after 1980, making the claim unverifiable.

attacks.text: The AFI does not have a separate list ranking the top 100 American movies released exclusively after 1980, making the claim unverifiable.
The AFI's 100 Years...100 Movies list includes films from all time periods, and Schindler's List ranks highly in the 1998 and 2007 editions, which could be interpreted as supporting the claim.
The AFI's lists are not restricted to post-1980 films, so interpreting Schindler's List's high rank as evidence for the claim is misleading without explicit post-1980 categorization.

supporting.text: AFI's 100 Years...100 Movies list includes films from all eras, and Schindler's List is not the highest-ranked film on that list, with Citizen Kane (1941) holding the top position.

attacks.text: AFI's 100 Years...100 Movies list includes films from all eras, and Schindler's List is not the highest-ranked film on that list, with Citizen Kane (1941) holding the top position.
The claim specifies films released after 1980, and Citizen Kane (1941) is irrelevant to this subset, so Schindler's List could still be the top-ranked post-1980 film.
The Shawshank Redemption (1994) is ranked higher than Schindler's List on AFI's list among post-1980 films, contradicting the claim.

supporting.text: If considering only post-1980 films on AFI's list, Schindler's List is among the highest-ranked, but it is not definitively labeled as 'the top' in any official AFI ranking.

attacks.text: If considering only post-1980 films on AFI's list, Schindler's List is among the highest-ranked, but it is not definitively labeled as 'the top' in any official AFI ranking.
AFI's 100 Years...100 Movies (10th Anniversary Edition) ranks Schindler's List at #8 overall, making it the highest-ranked post-1980 film on the list.
The AFI ranking does not explicitly label any film as 'the top post-1980 film,' so the claim is an interpretation rather than an official designation.
Other post-1980 films like Raging Bull (#4) and Raiders of the Lost Ark (#60) are also highly ranked, showing that Schindler's List is not uniquely positioned.
